intro: Crucihimalaya mongolica, commonly known as the Mongolian crucihimalaya, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often covered with fine hairs. Crucihimalaya mongolica is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations.
